title: The major difference between DPS and Burst is almost non-existent at this point.
body:
You have your standard burst mages/assassins, but since damage is THROUGH the roof items like {{item:3031}} {{item:3085}} on ADCs just makes them even more bursty on top of double crit yasuo with {{item:3087}}. It is almost like a race who can kill faster at this point. There is no real DPS/Sustained damage by anyone is league anymore. It is just spammy burst and fast killing. That is why when a fighter/bruiser builds {{item:3078}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3143}} They are literally unkillable because they get just enough tankiness to survive burst and do it themselves later. 
Assassins and burst mages are supposed to destroy the back line. Not marksmen. Marksmen are the sustained DPS to break frontliners and keep sustained damage for the team if the burst is dead. Honestly, the entire itemization of league of legends needs to be reworked to remove burst on champions that DON'T need burst at all.

I've got to admit, that it's pretty bullshit that riot has never addressed how power creep affects this interaction.

There's a couple of important cut offs which have never been addressed by riot, when it comes to power creep on gameplay.

Burst champions (assassins, mages, some fighters): break the 100-0 barrier, easier. This means that it takes fewer items in your build to kill someone in a single rotation of skills, allowing for more defensive items to be purchases without losing the ability to assassinate a target.

Burst damage on DPS mages: Mages which are intended to do damage over time, and lack combo burst damage start to see the 1 or 2 skills they have for burst, function as enough burst. {{champion:136}} {{champion:268}} {{champion:143}} to name a few.

DPS turning into Burst damage: Mostly when it comes to AD in this case, because AD isn't gated in the same way abilities are. When the limiting factor of abilities being able to 100-0 targets isn't their numbers, but rather the rate which they can be input, then what you see is that continued power creep only works to close the gap between the DPS damage, and burst damage. If DPS takes 2.5 seconds to kill a target, with almost none of that time being limited by input lag. Then a burst combo takes 1.0 seconds to kill a target, with about .5 of that time being input lag. Increasing everyone's effective damage by 100% would reduce the time to kill of the DPS to 1.25, but the burst combo's only to .75. A difference of 1.5sec => 0.5sec .
